title: Multichannel Sensor Analysis for Fall Detection: Evaluating Accelerometer, Gyroscope, and Magnetometer Data in Real-World Settings
description:
Processed wearable sensor data (accelerometer, gyroscope, magnetometer) for fall detection analysis.
Developed and compared tabular vs. time-series machine learning models using Scikit-learn and Aeon.
Identified acceleration-only models as most effective (F1 = 0.99, AUC = 1.0)
Highlighted an efficient, interpretable approach for real-world fall detection

title: Pizza Perplexion Data Visualization
description: Visualizing trends from a grocery store dataset. I found that Whole Foods pizzas are more expensive yet not healthier than pizzas from Walmart and Target.

title: Predicting Recipe Health Final Project
description: Built a supervised ML pipeline in Scikit-learn to classify recipe healthiness using ingredient data. Cleaned and preprocessed text-based ingredients, engineered features like ingredient count and binary indicators. Improved F1 score from 0.67 to 0.77 through cross-validation and hyperparameter tuning. Published report and visualizations on GitHub Pages using Jupyter Notebook and Markdown
